snippet: In a promising twist for the city’s survival as a place where things are made, an old factory in Brooklyn has avoided being converted to condos, the fate of many old industrial buildings.
abstract: Brooklyn is increasingly retaining some of its remaining industrial spaces for small-scale, small-batch manufacturing; by slicing and dicing these large buildings into several dozen small factories, companies keep wages, taxes and real estate costs lower and establish a more intimate relationship with their clients.
lead_paragraph: In a promising twist for the city’s survival as a place where things are made, an old factory in Brooklyn has avoided being converted to condos, the fate of many old industrial buildings.

headline.seo: Small Factories Thrive in Brooklyn, Replacing Industrial Giants
headline.main: Instead of Industrial Giants, Brooklyn Has Niche Factories
